intro: Tambourissa leptophylla, commonly known as the slender-leaf tambourissa, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in sandy soils and coastal areas. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in coastal dunes and sandy habitats, adapting well to harsh, saline environments. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
